instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
output:
Apr 26, 2019 · When you insert a chart in Microsoft Word 2016, you can either start from scratch by selecting the type of chart you want to create or you can insert a template that contains placeholder text for you to replace with your own data. This wikiHow teaches you how to start with a blank chart and how to insert a pre-made chart into your document. Open Microsoft Word.: You can find this application on your PC if you have an Office 365 subscription, or you can download a free trial of Word from Microsoft's website.
One way to get around it is to use placeholder text instead of your real content. That’s especially useful when you need to fill out a document before getting the “real” information. For example, let’s say you’re creating a flyer for a conference but you haven’t got all the details yet. Inserting dummy text into the document allows you to keep working on it while you wait for the rest of the information to come in. Note: Placeholder text typically won’t show up in the final PDF file. If you need placeholder text to appear in the final document, use a program like Adobe InDesign. This article will show you how to add placeholder text to a document in Microsoft Word.

instruction: A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.
input:
Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output: but not required.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
1. Open the pull request dialog and click on the Merge button in the top right corner.
2. In the following dialog, click on the "Conflicts" tab and review the list of files with conflicts.
3. Click on the edit icon (pencil) next to the file name to start editing the merged version.
4. Make your changes and save them.
5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 for all other files with conflicts until all conflicts have been resolved.
6. Click on the "Merge" button again in the top right corner to merge the pull request.

instruction: You are given some reviews for a movie. Each video might have mentioned some negative or positive points about the movie. Read them carefully and extract the positive and negative points mentioned in all of the reviews. Then, make a list of these points and summarize them as positive points and negative points.
input:
Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.
output: It's a shame. I was really looking forward to this movie, but in the end it disappointed me.

instruction: Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie.
input: Dead Poets Society
output: is a 1989 American drama film directed by Peter Weir and starring Robin Williams. The film follows the story of an English teacher who inspires his students to seize the day, as embodied in the dead poets society. The cinematography in the movie is beautiful and captures the essence of the story perfectly. The use of lighting and color creates a warm and inviting atmosphere that reflects the themes of the movie. The camerawork is also very impressive, with many memorable shots that help to tell the story. Overall, the cinematography in Dead Poets Society is a major contributor to the success of the movie and helps to create an unforgettable experience for audiences.

instruction: Name the top cities in France that should not be missed. Include the best aspects of each place as well.
output:
The top cities in France that should not be missed are Paris, Lyon, Marseille, Nice, Bordeaux, and Toulouse.
Paris is the capital of France and one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. It is known for its iconic landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, and Notre-Dame Cathedral. Paris is also renowned for its fashion, food, and nightlife scenes.
Lyon is the second largest city in France and is known as the gastronomic capital of the country. The city is famous for its cuisine, especially its signature dish, quenelle de brochet. Lyon is also home to many historical landmarks such as the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière and the Roman Theater of Fourvière.
Marseille is the oldest city in France and is known for its port, which is the largest in the country. The city is also famous for its sunny weather and sandy beaches.
Nice is a resort city on the French Riviera and is known for its luxury hotels and casinos. The city is also famous for its promenade, the Promenade des Anglais, and its annual jazz festival.
Bordeaux is a city in southwest France and is known for its wine production. The city is famous for its wine museums and chateaux, such as Château Haut-Brion. Bordeaux is also home to many historical landmarks such as the Pont Jacques Chaban-Delmas bridge and the Saint-André Cathedral.
Toulouse is a city in southwestern France and is known for its university, the Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse. The city is also famous for its architecture, especially its medieval buildings such as the Saint Sernin Church.
Overall, these cities offer a

instruction: Answer the following question.
input:
How do I compare strings in Java?
I've been using the == operator in my program to compare all my strings so far. However, I ran into a bug, changed one of them into .equals() instead, and it fixed the bug.
Is == bad? When should it and should it not be used? What's the difference?
output: As far as I know, == is used to compare objects while .equals() is used to compare their values, so you should use == when comparing the same data type and .equals() when comparing different data types.

instruction: You will need to guide this person through the scenario they have described for the interview.
input:
Finally! After a while of shooting in the dark and frantically fiddling with sample inputs on the whiteboard, you've came up with an algorithm for solving the coding question your interviewer gave you.
Whew. Such a relief to have a clear path forward. To not be flailing anymore.
Now you're cruising, getting ready to code up your solution.
When suddenly, your interviewer throws you a curve ball.
"What if we thought of the problem this way?"
You feel a tension we've all felt during the coding interview:
"Try to listen to what they're saying...but don't lose your train of thought...ugh, I can't do both!"
output:
It's a tough spot to be in, especially when you only have an hour with the interviewer. But here are some strategies that might help:
Don't panic. Deep breaths. This is a good thing. You should always be open to new ways of thinking about a problem. They may not have been thinking about it quite like this before, but this gives you a chance to show off your adaptability and creativity.
Calmly ask them to clarify how they would modify the problem so that you can work on it. This shows them you're listening and interested in their ideas.
Then go back to your original plan if need be.
I mean, you're probably going to use some of their modifications, right?

instruction: The given article should be checked for any scientific errors and corrected if necessary.
input: Zinc is an essential mineral that is required for good health. It is involved in many biochemical processes in the body and is necessary for the proper functioning of the immune system. Excess zink is not harmful as it is excreted in the urine.
output:
However, some people may be sensitive to zinc and experience side effects such as nausea, diarrhea, and stomach discomfort.
Studies have shown that high doses of zinc can interfere with copper absorption and cause copper deficiency. Therefore, it is important to ensure that you are getting enough copper in your diet if you are taking zinc supplements. Copper deficiency can lead to anemia, bone degeneration, and other health problems.

instruction: Make the article available in a second language by translating it into it.
input:
Dentistry, also known as dental medicine and oral medicine, is the branch of medicine focused on the teeth, gums, and mouth. It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.
Translate to French:
output: La dentisterie, aussi connue sous le nom de médecine dentaire ou médecine orale, est la branche de la médecine qui se concentre sur les dents, les gencives et la bouche. Elle comprend l'étude, la diagnostication, la prévention, la gestion et le traitement des maladies, désordres ou conditions des dents, de la mâchoire et de la muqueuse orale. Le praticien est appelé un dentiste.

instruction: An evaluation of the article's quality should be carried out. In order to do so, you should review the quality of the writing and the explanation of the topic.
input:
The 20th century saw a revolution in music listening as the radio gained popularity worldwide and new media and technologies were developed to record, edit and distribute music. Music performances became increasingly visual with the broadcast and recording of performances.
20th-century music brought new freedom and wide experimentation with new musical styles and forms that challenged the accepted rules of music of earlier periods. The invention of musical amplification and electronic instruments, especially the synthesizer, in the mid-20th century revolutionized classical and popular music, and accelerated the development of new forms of music.

instruction: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.
output:
Mental Exercise: The Anxiety-Reduction Technique
Take 5 deep breaths and focus on your breathing. Notice how your chest rises and falls with each breath. Concentrate on the air flowing in and out of your nose or mouth. After each breath, hold your breath for a few seconds and then exhale forcefully through pursed lips. Repeat this process for 10 minutes.

instruction: Provide a cooking hack for improving the flavor of the given food.
input: popcorn
output:
, chicken, ice cream
A cooking hack for improving the flavor of popcorn is to add a tablespoon of melted butter or oil to the kernels before popping them in the microwave. This will give the popcorn a richer, more flavorful taste.
A cooking hack for improving the flavor of chicken is to marinate it in a mixture of soy sauce, honey, ginger, garlic, and sesame oil for at least an hour before grilling or baking. This will create a delicious, sticky glaze that enhances the flavor of the chicken.
A cooking hack for improving the flavor of ice cream is to add a pinch of salt to the mix while it's freezing. This will make the ice cream creamier and enhance the flavors of any added toppings or mix-ins.

instruction: Solve this equation.

input: "If x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4, then x>0 and x>12."

instruction: Based on the facts that have been provided, prove the following statement.
input:
Statement: "For every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0"
Fact: The square of any real number is non-negative.
output: Proof: Let's use the fact that x^2 ≥ 0 for any real number x. Let k be a real number. Then, by squaring both sides of the inequality, we get x^2 + 2x + 1 ≥ 0. Since x can take on any real value, this is true for all real numbers. Therefore, the square of any integer is non-negative, which proves the statement.

input: Derek Jeter, Albert Pujols
output:
, Alex Rodriguez
Overview 1. Derek Jeter is a retired professional baseball player who played his entire career with the New York Yankees. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest shortstops of all time and is known for his exceptional hitting, fielding, and leadership skills.
2. Albert Pujols is a current Major League Baseball player who plays for the Los Angeles Angels. He is a three-time World Series champion, a seven-time MLB All-Star, and a three-time National League Most Valuable Player. He is considered one of the best hitters in baseball history and has consistently ranked among the league leaders in home runs and RBIs.
3. Alex Rodriguez is a retired professional baseball player who played for the Seattle Mariners, Texas Rangers, and New York Yankees during his career. He is a three-time American League Most Valuable Player and a 14-time All-Star. He is also known for his exceptional hitting and fielding abilities, and was once considered one of the best players in the game.

instruction: Choose an appealing title for your post.
input: The typical avocado is over 300 calories from the oil in it. That’s the amount of calories in a large candy bar. If you get enough exercise to eat a large candy bar every day without gaining weight, it wouldn’t be a problem to eat an avocado every day. Other wise you should probably eat them sparingly.
output: I eat avocados almost every day and I don't gain weight. A medium sized avocado has about 320 calories and 30g of fat, which is a lot, but it also has lots of water and fiber so it doesn't really bother my stomach too much.

instruction: Describe the responsibilities of the given job.
input: Security Officer
output:
Job Description
Security officers are responsible for protecting people, property, and assets from harm. They patrol assigned areas, guard entrances and exits, monitor surveillance cameras, and respond to alarms and emergencies. As a Security Officer, you will need to be able to think quickly and react calmly in high-stress situations. You must also possess excellent communication skills, as you will regularly interact with staff, visitors, and law enforcement. The job requires physical strength and endurance, as well as the ability to stand and walk for long periods of time.

instruction: Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.
input: We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse

instruction: Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.
input: Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.

instruction: List the concepts that should be learned before approaching the given complex concept.
input: Deep Learning
output:
, along with Neural Networks and Artificial Intelligence (AI), is one of the most promising fields of Machine Learning for many applications. However, it is not easy to get a good start in this field. In this article, we will try to explain what Deep Learning is, how it works, and what are its key concepts. We will begin by introducing some basic concepts from neural networks, and then gradually move on to more advanced topics such as backpropagation and deep neural networks.
1. Neurons: The building blocks of the brain
The human brain is an extremely complex organ that allows us to think, feel, and perform various tasks. One of the key components of the brain is neurons, which are specialized cells that are responsible for transmitting signals between different parts of the brain. Neurons are organized into networks that allow the brain to process information quickly and efficiently.
2. Synapses: The connections between neurons
Another important component of the brain is synapses, which are the connections between neurons. When a neuron receives a signal, it sends a message to another neuron through a synapse. This allows neurons to communicate with each other and enables the brain to carry out complex tasks.
3. Activation functions: How neurons respond to inputs
Neurons can be configured to respond to different types of inputs. For example, they can be designed to respond to changes in input values or to the presence of certain patterns in the input data. The way neurons respond to inputs is determined by activation functions. There are many different types of activation functions, but some of the most common ones include the logistic function, the rectified linear unit (ReLU), and the tanh function.
4. Weights: How neurons are connected
Neurons are connected to each other through weights. These weights determine how strongly a neuron responds

instruction: Create a list of subtopics for the given topic.
input: Music theory
output:
is the study of the practices and possibilities of music. It aims to analyze, describe, and understand music.
Music theory encompasses the nature of tone, rhythm, melody, and harmony. It also takes into account how sounds can be generated musically and physically.
Music theory is an academic discipline that involves identifying, analyzing, describing, and synthesizing the intrinsic structures and behaviors of music. It seeks to understand how people produce music, how audiences respond to it, and what functions music serves in different cultures. It also seeks to find a universal basis for the description of music.
The word "theory" comes from the Latin word theoria, meaning "looking at, contemplation, or gazing". The term "music theory" was first used around 1470–1530. It deals with scales, chords, modes, musical notation, tuning, orchestration, harmony, counterpoint, rhythm, metre, sonata form, and other aspects of Western music.

instruction: As part of software engineering, user stories describe what the user wants the system to do, while acceptance criteria describe the conditions a specific user story must meet. Create basic acceptance criteria based on the given user story.
input: User story: As a user, I want to use a search field to type a city, name, or street, so that I could find matching hotel options.
output: Acceptance criteria: The search field should accept a single word or phrase. The system should respond with a list of matching hotel options based on the entered keyword. The results should include the name and location of each hotel, as well as its price range and star rating.

instruction: A user story is an informal, general explanation of a software feature written from the perspective of the end user or customer. Write a user story for a given software.
input: Gmail
output: is a web-based email service provided by Google. It allows users to send and receive emails, store unlimited messages in their account, and access their emails from any device with an internet connection. Users can also customize their inbox with labels, filters, and themes, and can collaborate on emails with other users.

instruction: Provide an ESRB rating for the following game.
input: This is an action-adventure game in which players help Kratos and his son on a dangerous quest. Players explore various realms and engage in frenetic hand-to-hand combat against human-like raiders and fantastical creatures (e.g., centaurs, trolls, dragons). Players use axes and chained blades to battle enemies, often resulting in large blood-splatter effects and dismemberment. Players can perform finishing attacks that depict close-up impalement via bladed and hand-held weapons; repeated axe strikes to a creature's neck results in decapitation. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” are heard in the game.

instruction: Predict how many stars the author will give to the restaurant from a Yelp review.

The bread was very good. I ordered the muscle fries. They had a sweet Vidalia onion flavor. No need for fries bc they were soggy wo much flavor. My boyfriend ordered a pesto chicken pasta and it was again mediocre.

A little dry and bland for my taste.
All in all, I would go back to this place if i was in the area, but id probably get take out.
